parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

connection.name: connection
connection.description: ConnectionProvider that returns instances of WscSoapClient.

parameter.name: soapVersion
parameter.description: The soap version of the WSDL.

parameter.name: mtomEnabled
parameter.description: If should use the MTOM protocol to manage the attachments or not.

parameter.name: customTransportConfiguration
parameter.description: The transport configuration used to dispatch the SOAP messages.

parameter.name: wsdlLocation
parameter.description: The WSDL file URL remote or local.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: The service name.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port name.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The address of the web service.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: signSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a sign WSS configuration

parameter.name: verifySignatureSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a verify signature WSS configuration

parameter.name: usernameTokenSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a usernameToken WSS configuration

parameter.name: timestampSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a timestamp WSS configuration

parameter.name: decryptSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a decrypt WSS configuration

parameter.name: encryptSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: an encrypt WSS configuration

parameter.name: incomingTimestampSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a timestamp verification WSS configuration

connection.description: ConnectionProvider that returns instances of WscSoapClient.

parameter.name: soapVersion
parameter.description: The soap version of the WSDL.

parameter.name: mtomEnabled
parameter.description: If should use the MTOM protocol to manage the attachments or not.

parameter.name: customTransportConfiguration
parameter.description: The transport configuration used to dispatch the SOAP messages.

parameter.description: The WSDL file URL remote or local.

parameter.name: service
parameter.description: The service name.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port name.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The address of the web service.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: signSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a sign WSS configuration

parameter.name: verifySignatureSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a verify signature WSS configuration

parameter.name: usernameTokenSecurityStrategy
parameter.description: a usernameToken WSS configuration

extension.name: Web Service Consumer
extension.description: Web Service Consumer extension used to consume SOAP web services.

operation.name: consume
operation.description: Consumes an operation from a SOAP Web Service.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.description: the name of the web service operation that aims to invoke.

parameter.name: body
parameter.description: The XML body to include in the SOAP message, with all the required parameters, or null if no params are required.

parameter.name: headers
parameter.description: The XML headers to include in the SOAP message.

parameter.name: attachments
parameter.description: The attachments to include in the SOAP request.

parameter.name: transportHeaders
parameter.description: A group of transport headers that will be bounded with the transport request.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.SoapAttributes

parameter.name: protocolHeaders
parameter.description: The protocol headers bundled in the response.

parameter.name: additionalTransportData
parameter.description: The additional transport data bundled in the response.

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.SoapOutputEnvelope
type.description:
Represents the response of the consume operation. Bundles the SOAP body, SOAP Headers and Mime Attachments if there are any.
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.security.WssDecryptSecurityStrategyAdapter
type.description:
Decrypts an encrypted SOAP response, using the private key of the key-store in the provided TLS context.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: keyStoreConfiguration
parameter.description: The keystore to use when decrypting the message.

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.security.WssEncryptSecurityStrategyAdapter
type.description:
Verifies the signature of a SOAP response, using certificates of the trust-store in the provided TLS context.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: keyStoreConfiguration
parameter.description: The keystore to use when encrypting the message.

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.security.WssIncomingTimestampSecurityStrategyAdapter

parameter.name: futureTimeToLive
parameter.description: Specifies the time in the future within which the Created time of an incoming Timestamp is valid. The default value is "60", to avoid problems where clocks are slightly askew. To reject all future-created Timestamps, set this value to "0".

parameter.name: futureTimeToLiveUnit
parameter.description:
A #futureTimeToLive parameter.

Defaults to SECONDS

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.security.WssSignSecurityStrategyAdapter
type.description:
Signs the SOAP request that is being sent, using the private key of the key-store in the provided TLS context.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: keyStoreConfiguration
parameter.description: The keystore to use when signing the message.

parameter.name: signAlgorithmConfiguration
parameter.description: The algorithms to use on the signing.

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.security.WssTimestampSecurityStrategyAdapter
type.description:
Bundles the outgoing SOAP message that it's being built with a timestamp that carries the creation.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: timeToLive
parameter.description:
The time difference between creation and expiry time in the time unit specified in timeToLiveUnit. After this time the message is invalid.

This parameter values must be greater or equal to 1 second (or similar in other unit). Values lower than 1 second will end up in 1 second timestamp.

parameter.name: timeToLiveUnit
parameter.description:
A #timeToLive parameter.

Defaults to SECONDS

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.security.WssUsernameTokenSecurityStrategyAdapter

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username required to authenticate with the service.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password for the provided username required to authenticate with the service.

parameter.name: passwordType
parameter.description: A #password parameter.

parameter.name: addNonce
parameter.description: Specifies a if a cryptographically random nonce should be added to the message.

parameter.name: addCreated
parameter.description: Specifies if a timestamp should be created to indicate the creation time of the message.

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.security.WssVerifySignatureSecurityStrategyAdapter
type.description:
Verifies the signature of a SOAP response, using certificates of the trust-store in the provided TLS context.
@since 1.0

parameter.name: trustStoreConfiguration
parameter.description: The truststore to use to verify the signature.

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.transport.CustomHttpTransportConfiguration
type.description:
Provides the capability to send soap messages using a custom HTTP Requester configuration.
@since 1.1

type.name: org.mule.extension.ws.api.transport.CustomTransportConfiguration
org.mule.extension.ws.api.transport.DefaultHttpTransportConfiguration
type.description:
DTO subtype used to instantiate DefaultHttpTransportConfigurationImpl objects.
@since 1.1
